main event: An unidentified round to crescent shaped object, blue in color, was sighted in the sky near Guthrie and Parkersburg, West Virginia, on December 11, 1957.
interesting points: Three pilots thought the object was the moon, despite radar indications suggesting it was something else,The object was observed for approximately 20 to 30 minutes,The object had erratic movements and was reported as being larger than aircraft,Ground observers at 45,000 feet confirmed the sighting,The official conclusion suggested it was likely a balloon or aircraft, despite the radar discrepancy.
sighted object: one round to crescent shaped blue object
